chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Robert D. Brostowitz was found guilty of OWI (6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to 14CF7, 15CF25 and any other sentence in being

superMiscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant is not required to make payments on financial obligations until placed on extended supervision.

Maintain absolute sobriety. May not enter or be on the premises of any bar, tavern, liquor store or other establishment with the primary purpose of the sale and/or consumption of alcohol. Complete any assessment, counseling or programming deemed appropriate by the risk assessment supervising agent.
Submit to AODA assessment and comply with any recommendations.

supervisions.notes: Failure to comply with alcohol program as prescribed will result in further DL revocation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert D. Brostowitz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Clerk's Note:  Per request of review of transcript by Atty. Lex and authorization by Judge Fox, JOC is corrected.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
3:45 pm - 14CF7, 15CF8, 15CF25 - Defendant Robert D. Brostowitz in court with attorney James R. Lex.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have received and reviewed PSI. DA states recommendation. Comments by Attorney Lex. Comments by DE. Comments and ruling by Court. Court provides written explanation of determinate sentence. DE is eligible for substance abuse program and not eligible for challenge incarceration.  Appeal rights given. Adj. 4:22 pm.
Court imposes:
(14CF7 - Ct. 1) - 2 year prison term, with credit for 11 days served (1 yr initial confinement, 1 year extended supervision), consecutive to 15CF8, 15CF25 and any other sentence in being.
Conditions of extended supervision:
$3214 fine; $63 BDF; 3 yr DL rev; 3 yr IID; AODA
Maintain absolute sobriety; Not enter or be on the premises of any bar, tavern, liquor store or other establishment with the primary purpose of the sale and/or consumption of alcohol; Complete any assessment, counseling or programming deemed appropriate by the risk assessment supervising agent

(15CF8 - Ct. 1) - 3 year prison term (18 months initial confinement, 18 months extended supervision), consecutive to 14CF7, 15CF25 and any other sentence in being.
Conditions of extended supervision:
$3500 fine; $65.50 BDF; 3 yr DL rev; 3 yr IID; AODA
Maintain absolute sobriety; Not enter or be on the premises of any bar, tavern, liquor store or other establishment with the primary purpose of the sale and/or consumption of alcohol; Complete any assessment, counseling or programming deemed appropriate by the risk assessment supervising agent

(15CF25 - Ct. 1) - 6 year prison term, with credit for 89 days served (3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision), consecutive to 14CF7, 15CF8 and any other sentence in being.
Conditions of extended supervision:
$4000 fine; $65.50 BDF; 3 yr DL rev; 3 yr IID; AODA; Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge
Maintain absolute sobriety; Not enter or be on the premises of any bar, tavern, liquor store or other establishment with the primary purpose of the sale and/or consumption of alcohol; Complete any assessment, counseling or programming deemed appropriate by the risk assessment supervising agent

2:05 pm - 15CF25, 15CF8 & 14CF7 - Defendant Robert D. Brostowitz in court with attorney James R. Lex.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Lex states request for 48 hour furlough and states reasons. Response by DA. Further comment by Attorney Lex. Comments and ruling by Court. Court denies request. Comments and questions by DE.  Further comment by Court. Adj. 2:12 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Robert D. Brostowitz
Current: N906 Linden Avenue, Ogema, WI 54459   (Effective: 06-05-2015)
Prior: N906 Linden Road, Ogema, WI 54459 United States

10:14 am - DA calls cases 14CF7, 15CF8 and 15CF25 and states appearance.  Defendant Robert D. Brostowitz in court with attorney James R. Lex.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information file in 15CF8 and 15CF25, acknowleged and reading is waived.  Information previously filed in 14CF7.  Waiver of prel previously done in 14CF7.  Written waiver on 15CF8 and 15CF25 handed to Judge.  Court accepts waiver.  DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to count 1 on all three cases.    Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on CT 1 of 14CF7, 15CF8. and 15CF25, and on motion of the state, dismisses all other counts on all the cases.  Court orders PSI on all cases.  DE is informed that he may not vote or possess a firearm.

Defendant Robert D. Brostowitz appeared with attorney James R. Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.  Warrant lifted.

2:01 pm - Defendant does not appear.  Attorney James R. Lex appeared by telephone.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Comments and request by Atty. Lex.  Response by DA.  Court lifts warrant and defendant's next court date is 03-24-15 @ 10:00 am.  Adj. 2:04 pm.

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  Defendant may NOT consume alcohol; Defendant may NOT operate a motor vehicle; May NOT leave the residence of Timothy Bleck in Ogema, WI unless accompanied by a sober adult and if he does leave the residence it may only be for the following purposes:  medical appointments, grocery, pharmacy, church, court dates or ISP meetings.
10:17 am - Defendant does not appear.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney James R. Lex appeared.  Court orders warrant $2500 + $25WF with all conditions on previous bond.

ADDRESS INFO for Robert D. Brostowitz
Current: N906 Linden Road, Ogema, WI 54459 United States  (Effective: 02-26-2015)
Prior: Price County Jail 164 Cherry Street, Phillips, WI 54555

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  Defendant may NOT consume alcohol; Defendant may NOT operate a motor vehicle; May NOT leave the residence of Timothy Bleck in Ogema, WI unless accompanied by a sober adult and if he does leave the residence it may only be for the following purposes:  medical appointments, grocery, pharmacy, church, court dates or ISP meetings.

3:47 pm -14CF7 & 15CF8 - Defendant Robert D. Brostowitz in court, in person with attorney James R. Lex appearing by telephone.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Comments by parties.  Atty. Lex moves for signature bond on both cases.  DA states recommendation and conditions.  Exam by Court.  DA comments.  Court grants $10,000 signature bond, one bond for both cases with the following conditions:  Defendant may NOT consume alcohol; Defendant may NOT operate a motor vehicle; May NOT leave the residence of Timothy Bleck in Ogema, WI unless accompanied by a sober adult and if he does leave the residence it may only be for the following purposes:  medical appointments, grocery, pharmacy, church, court dates or ISP meetings.
Search warrant for OWI; Affidavit; Return of officer
